intro: Minuartia mediterranea var. confertiflora, commonly known as the Mediterranean rock白菜, is a low-growing perennial plant native to southern Europe. It features small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has a mat-forming habit with fleshy, blue-green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to full sun. This variety is notable for its resilience to drought and its ability to colonize exposed, barren habitats.
